hero.title: Duomo
hero.subtitle: Di Milano
hero.description: Experience the gothic grandeur. Ascend to the rooftops and walk among the spires of the world's most beautiful cathedral.

history.title: Six Centuries of History
history.description: The Duomo is not just a building; it is a story carved in marble that spans generations. It took nearly 600 years to complete.
history.step1_desc: Archbishop Antonio da Saluzzo breaks ground. Gian Galeazzo Visconti provides exclusive access to the pink Candoglia marble.
history.step2_desc: Napoleon Bonaparte orders its completion to crown himself King of Italy. A statue of Napoleon was placed atop one of the spires.
history.step3_desc: The cathedral is complete, standing as the 3rd largest church in the world. The 'Veneranda Fabbrica' works daily to maintain it.

features.marble_desc: The entire cathedral is built from unique pink-hued marble quarried from Lake Maggiore.
features.statues_desc: More statues than any other building in the world. From saints to gargoyles, the façade is alive.
features.madonnina_desc: Standing at 108 meters, the golden statue of Mary protects the city of Milan.

secrets.title: Secrets of the Stone
secrets.item1_desc: Look closely at the façade. Among the saints, you can find statues representing modern sports.
secrets.item2_desc: On the balcony, the statue 'The New Law' (1810) bears a striking resemblance to New York's Lady Liberty.
secrets.item3_desc: High above the altar, a red light marks the spot of a nail believed to be from the True Cross.

guide.title: Plan Your Perfect Visit
guide.card1_desc: The most magical time to visit the terraces is one hour before sunset.
guide.card2_desc: Lines can be hours long. Our Fast-Track Combo tickets let you bypass the general queue.
guide.card3_desc: Avoid the tourist traps. We've listed the top 5 authentic trattorias nearby.

reviews.title: Traveler Reviews
reviews.r1_text: The booking process was seamless. We received the QR codes instantly and walked right past the ticket line.
reviews.r2_text: Highly recommend the Combo Lift ticket. Climbing the last stairs to the very top is worth it for the photos.
reviews.r3_text: Reliable service. We were worried about the tickets not working but everything was smooth at the turnstiles.

info.title: Essential Information
info.subtitle: Know before you go.
info.faq1_q: Is there a strict dress code?
info.faq1_a: YES. The Duomo is an active cathedral and strict rules apply. Both men and women must cover their shoulders and knees. Sleeveless tops, shorts, and mini-skirts are not permitted.
info.faq2_q: What is the difference between Lift and Stairs?
info.faq2_a: The 'Combo Lift' ticket allows you to take an elevator to the first level of the terraces, skipping approximately 200 steps. However, to reach the very top rooftop, everyone must walk the final flight of stairs.
info.faq3_q: Can I change my ticket date?
info.faq3_a: Tickets are valid for 72 hours from the selected date to allow for flexibility in case of travel delays. However, each specific area can only be accessed once within that window.
info.faq4_q: Is the Museum open every day?
info.faq4_a: No. The Duomo Museum and the Church of San Gottardo are CLOSED on Wednesdays. If you book for a Wednesday, you can still visit the Cathedral and the Rooftop Terraces.

location.title: Getting There
location.metro_desc: Take the Yellow Line (M3) or Red Line (M1) and get off at Duomo station.
location.tram_desc: Lines 2, 3, 14, and 15 stop at Via Torino, just 2 minutes walk from the cathedral.

CookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
CookiePolicy.intro_1: This Cookie Policy explains how <bold>Access To Italy</bold> ("we", "us", and "our") uses cookies and similar technologies to recognize you when you visit our website. It explains what these technologies are and why we use them, as well as your rights to control our use of them.
CookiePolicy.intro_2: In some cases, we may use cookies to collect personal information, or that becomes personal information if we combine it with other information.
CookiePolicy.what_text_1: Cookies are small data files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. Cookies are widely used by website owners in order to make their websites work, or to work more efficiently, as well as to provide reporting information.
CookiePolicy.what_text_2: Cookies set by the website owner (us) are called "first-party cookies". Cookies set by parties other than the website owner are called "third-party cookies". Third-party cookies enable third-party features or functionality to be provided on or through the website (e.g., advertising, interactive content, and analytics).
CookiePolicy.why_text: We use first- and third-party cookies for several reasons. Some cookies are required for technical reasons in order for our Website to operate, and we refer to these as "essential" or "strictly necessary" cookies. Other cookies also enable us to track and target the interests of our users to enhance the experience on our Online Properties.
CookiePolicy.type_necessary_desc: These cookies are strictly necessary to provide you with services available through our Website and to use some of its features, such as access to secure areas.
CookiePolicy.type_analytics_desc: These cookies are used to collect information about traffic to our Website and how users use our Website. The information gathered does not identify any individual visitor.
CookiePolicy.type_marketing_desc: These cookies are used to make advertising messages more relevant to you. They perform functions like preventing the same ad from continuously reappearing.
CookiePolicy.control_text_1: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie rights by setting your preferences in the Cookie Banner that appears when you first visit the website.
CookiePolicy.control_text_2: Additionally, most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings preferences.
CookiePolicy.contact_text: If you have any questions about our use of cookies or other technologies, please email us at:

Contact.title: Contact Support
Contact.subtitle_1: Have a question about your booking? We're here to help.
Contact.subtitle_2: Check our FAQ below for instant answers.
Contact.form_success_desc: We'll get back to you shortly.
Contact.faq_1_q: I haven't received my tickets yet.
Contact.faq_1_a: Tickets are usually sent instantly, but can take up to 10 minutes. Please check your Spam/Junk folder. If you still can't find them, please provide your Order ID in the form, and we will resend them immediately.
Contact.faq_2_q: Can I cancel or reschedule my booking?
Contact.faq_2_a: Yes. You can cancel for a full refund or reschedule up to 24 hours before your visit time. Requests made within 24 hours of the visit are non-refundable.
Contact.faq_3_a: Shoulders and knees must be covered for both men and women. This is strictly enforced by cathedral security. You may be denied entry without refund if you do not comply.
Contact.faq_4_q: Do I need to print my tickets?
Contact.faq_4_a: No. You can show the QR code directly from your smartphone at the entrance turnstiles.
Contact.office_note: Please note: This address is for administrative purposes only. No tickets are sold at this location.
